patterns: Tell me about MMC Digital Lab
responses: The MMC Digital Lab is the Research and Creative Development team for the Media, Marketing, and Communications Scholars program.
We help push long-term initiatives of the MMC Scholars and offer short-term graphic and video services for The Honors and Scholars Center.

patterns: Do I need to be in the MMC Scholars program?
responses: You don’t need to be in the MMC Scholars program. We welcome any student with a strong willingness to learn!
Most students work 5-10 hours per week. The schedule is flexible to fit your class schedule.
If you average at least 6 hours per week, you'll be promoted and receive a $1 raise each year.
We have the Creative Development Team and the Research Development Team.
Our teams include Video, Motion Graphics, Graphics, Data, and Web Development.

patterns: What software or languages will I use?
responses: Students learn software like Adobe Creative Suite, Unreal Engine, Swift, Tableau, Excel, Access, and web programming languages like JavaScript.
No prior experience is necessary—just bring a good attitude and interest in learning!
Students start by learning software and programming languages, then complete small practice tasks. Once ready, they work on frontline projects under supervision.
No prior experience is needed! Just bring a positive attitude and willingness to learn.

patterns: Can I work in more than one area?
responses: Yes, but students should focus on one area until they have the opportunity to branch out.
You must have a Federal Work Study award, work at least 6 hours per week, be hardworking, constantly learn and improve skills, and read all emails and notify in advance if missing a shift.
